thread.title: InFocus launches new smartphone with 13MP camera
thread.title_full: InFocus launches new smartphone with 13MP camera

author: Deccan
title: InFocus launches new smartphone with 13MP camera
text:
Deccan Chronicle | September 23, 2015, 14.42 pm The new InFocus phablet supports 4GLTE connectivity InFocus has rolled out its new 5.5-inch smartphone - Infocus M812, which is 7.3mm slim and has a anodized aluminum uni-body design. The 5.5-inch Full HD IPS display on InFocus M812 comes with a Corning Gorilla Glass 3 glass protection. Sharp contrast, high resolution, extreme clarity and built-in Blue Light filter, makes the viewing experience an ultimate pleasure. This handset has a stellar 13MP rear shooter with a dual tone and an 8MP front-facing camera with 80-degree wide angle lens.
The InFocus M812 offers 3GB of RAM and is powered by a 2.5GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 801 processor running on 64-bit CPU architecture. It runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop based on InLife UI 2.0 and also supports 4G LTE connectivity. The newly launched InFocus M812 smartphone is fuelled by a 2900mAh. With a quick charging capability, the company claims that the battery charges up to 40 per cent in 30 minutes flat and in one hour it hits 80 per cent. The battery has a network connecting standby time of up to 500 hours and one can play HD videos for up to 7 hours without disruption.
InFocus M812 smartphone is priced at Rs 19,999 and will be available exclusively on Snapdeal.
